rpSelenzyme’s documentation¶

Indices and tables¶

Introduction¶

Welcome to the documentation for rpSelenzyme. This project extends the Selenzyme project from Pablo Carbonel to be used by rpSBML files, and parse the ReactionRules within the files.

Usage¶

First build the rpBase docker before building the local docker:

docker build -t brsynth/rpselenzyme-standalone:v2 -f Dockerfile .

To call the docker locally you can use the following command:

python run.py -input /path/to/file -input_format tar -taxonomy_input 83333 -taxonomy_format string -output /path/to/output

API¶

class rpToolServe.runSelenzyme_hdd(inputTar, outputTar, pathway_id='rp_pathway', host_taxonomy_id=83333, num_results=50, direction=0, noMSA=True, fp='RDK', rxntype='smarts', min_aa_length=100)¶

Run rpSelenzyme on a collection of rpSBML files in the form of a TAR file

Parameters

  • inputTar – The path to the input collection of rpSBML as a TAR file

  • outputTar – The output file path

  • pathway_id – Group id of the heterologous pathway (Default: rp_pathway)

  • host_taxonomy_id – The taxonomy id of the host (Default: 83333, ie. E.Coli)

  • num_results – Number of UNIPROT id’s to return per reaction rule (Default: 50)

  • direction – Forward (1) to reverse (0) direction (Default: 0)

  • noMSA – Perform sequence alignement or not (Default: True)

  • fp – Fingerprint for reactants for quickRSiml (Default: RDK)

  • rxntype – The type of reaction rule. Valid options: smarts, smiles. (Default: smarts)

  • min_aa_length – Filter the UNIRPOT proteins and return only whose amino acid lengths are greater than the input value. (Default: 100)

  • inputTar – str

  • outputTar – str

  • reaction_smile – str

  • host_taxonomy_id – int

  • num_results – int

  • direction – int

  • noMSA – bool

  • fp – str

  • rxntype – str

  • min_aa_length – int

Return type

bool

Returns

The success or failure of the function

class rpTool.singleReactionRule(reaction_rule, host_taxonomy_id, num_results=50, direction=0, noMSA=True, fp='RDK', rxntype='smarts')¶

Query Selenzyme given a single reaction rule

Parameters

  • reaction_rule – The reaction rule

  • host_taxonomy_id – The taxonomy id associated with the reaction rule

  • num_results – The number of uniprot ids to return (Default: 50)

  • direction – Forward (1) to reverse (0) direction (Default: 0)

  • noMSA – Perform sequence alignement or not (Default: True)

  • fp – Fingerprint for reactants for quickRSiml (Default: RDK)

  • rxntype – The type of reaction rule. Valid options: smarts, smiles. (Default: smarts)

  • reaction_rule – str

  • host_taxonomy_id – int

  • num_results – int

  • direction – int

  • noMSA – bool

  • fp – str

  • rxntype – str

Return type

dict

Returns

The UNIPROT id’s and its associated score

class rpTool.singleSBML(rpsbml, host_taxonomy_id=83333, pathway_id='rp_pathway', num_results=50, direction=0, noMSA=True, fp='RDK', rxntype='smarts', min_aa_length=100)¶

Return UNIPROT id’s associated with each reaction using Selenzyme, from a rpSBML object

Parameters

  • rpsbml – The input rppSBML object

  • host_taxonomy_id – The taxonomy id of the host (Default: 83333, ie. E.Coli)

  • pathway_id – Group id of the heterologous pathway (Default: rp_pathway)

  • num_results – Number of UNIPROT id’s to return per reaction rule (Default: 50)

  • direction – Forward (1) to reverse (0) direction (Default: 0)

  • noMSA – Perform sequence alignement or not (Default: True)

  • fp – Fingerprint for reactants for quickRSiml (Default: RDK)

  • rxntype – The type of reaction rule. Valid options: smarts, smiles. (Default: smarts)

  • min_aa_length – Filter the UNIRPOT proteins and return only whose amino acid lengths are greater than the input value. (Default: 100)

  • rpsbml – rpSBML object

  • host_taxonomy_id – int

  • pathway_id – str

  • num_results – int

  • direction – int

  • noMSA – bool

  • fp – str

  • rxntype – str

  • min_aa_length – int

Return type

bool

Returns

The success or failure of the function

class run.main(inputfile, output, input_format, pathway_id, num_results, taxonomy_format, taxonomy_input, direction, noMSA, fp, rxntype, min_aa_length)¶

Run rpSelenzyme on a collection of rpSBML files in the form of a TAR file

Parameters

  • inputTar – The path to the input collection of rpSBML as a TAR file or single rpSBML file

  • outputTar – The output file path

  • input_format – The input file format. Valid options: sbml, tar

  • pathway_id – Group id of the heterologous pathway (Default: rp_pathway)

  • num_results – Number of UNIPROT id’s to return per reaction rule (Default: 50)

  • taxonomy_format – The input format of the taxonomy. Valid options: json, str

  • taxonomy_input – The input of the taxonomy id of the host oeganism

  • direction – Forward (1) to reverse (0) direction (Default: 0)

  • noMSA – Perform sequence alignement or not (Default: True)

  • fp – Fingerprint for reactants for quickRSiml (Default: RDK)

  • rxntype – The type of reaction rule. Valid options: smarts, smiles. (Default: smarts)

  • min_aa_length – Filter the UNIRPOT proteins and return only whose amino acid lengths are greater than the input value. (Default: 100)

  • inputTar – str

  • outputTar – str

  • input_format – str

  • pathway_id – str

  • num_results – int

  • taxonomy_format – str

  • taxonomy_input – str

  • direction – int

  • noMSA – bool

  • fp – str

  • rxntype – str

  • min_aa_length – int

Return type

None

Returns

None
